summary: Defines a compact Atrous Spatial Pyramid Pooling (ASPP) block that applies parallel dilated convolutions with configurable rates, concatenates their outputs, and optionally projects and drops out the combined features, serving as a reusable module for encoder-decoder segmentation networks.
business_intent: Enable developers of medical imaging segmentation models to incorporate multi-scale contextual feature aggregation easily, improving model performance and robustness in clinical image analysis applications.
